content:
Hi, I'm looking into parsing arguments to custom tool attributes, e.g.

#![feature(register_tool)]
#![register_tool(mytool)]

// I want to parse the arguments to my tool attributes
#[mytool::foo(abc @ def, x @ y)]
fn bar() {

}

Hooking into rustc, I get a rustc_ast::tokenstream::TokenStream for the arguments to mytool::foo, which I'd like to parse. Currently I'm using a custom ad-hoc parser to parse really simple arguments, but that does not really scale to more complex attributes.
Is there some good existing approach to creating custom parsers for these TokenStreams?

(I was hoping for something along the lines of the parse module provided by the syn crate, which however works on proc_macro TokenStreams)
